function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Use of data from only 15 cities in the united states may not be representative of the entire country and may lead to biased results.","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Focused sample of households in rural western uganda may not be representative of the population of uganda and may lead to biased results.","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on google’s community mobility report for severity of lockdown may not account for demographic or socioeconomic differences within the countries.","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incentivizing higher land values over green and open spaces in city centres.","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large numbers of people entering parks against guidelines","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumption of benefits from proximity to parks","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate information integration and analytics","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of systematic investigation, classification, and comparison of ontology-based solutions and tool support for covid-19 analytics","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of accurate pandemic data collection","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of ontology-based covid-19 data","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risks associated with insufficient data representation and semantic analysis of covid-19 information","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited capabilities in addressing technical challenges of covid-19 analytics","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on big data analytics for real-time contact tracing can result in privacy breaches and data security risks.","category":"Security","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Utilization of ontological reasoning and knowledge graphs may lead to inaccuracies in covid-19 analytics and recommendations.","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of systematic studies exploring the utilization of ontologies in designing and supporting covid-19 analytics can lead to limited understanding and suboptimal use of ontological solutions.","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion criteria not being clearly defined","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Missing out on latest studies and preprints","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate analysis of covid-19 specific ontologies","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Studies focusing on contagious diseases propagation and control","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential bias in study selection","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of duplicate studies inclusion","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proposing new ontologies without proper validation or testing","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of reporting on the tools used to develop proposed ontologies","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited automation of existing tools for rule execution and data annotation","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential dissemination of inaccurate or misleading information about covid-19 due to the use of semi-autonomous systems and telehealth care.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardization in data collection and annotation for covid-19 medication","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate semantic interoperability of unstructured data in the covid-19 domain","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of data from iot sensors for covid-19 infection transmission and health symptoms monitoring","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of rigor in evaluating proposed solutions","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Immaturity of covid-19 analytics literature","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in estimating the number of infected individuals from wastewater viral rna copy numbers","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sequencing and bioinformatics processes for taqman rt-qpcr products","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incorporating uncertainty and variability in independent variables using a monte carlo approach may introduce errors in the modeling process.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Modeling sars-cov-2 rna copies/l of wastewater as a point estimate with a uniform distribution may lead to underestimation or overestimation of viral load.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Modeling the shedding rate of sars-cov-2 rna copies/g of feces as a log-uniform distribution may introduce variability that impacts the accuracy of infection prevalence estimates.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High sensitivity of infection estimates to sars-cov-2 rna copies in stool and wastewater","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low sensitivity of infection estimates to the daily per capita flow rate of wastewater","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of wastewater samples for early detection of covid-19 may lead to false positives or false negatives due to different assay sensitivities.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in assay sensitivity and lod limit of detection may lead to inconsistent results in detecting sars-cov-2 rna in wastewater samples.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of multiple assays with varying sensitivity for detecting sars-cov-2 in wastewater samples may lead to conflicting or inconclusive results.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent results between different assays when concentrations are low","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Viral rna shedding in stool not included in the model, leading to underestimation of prevalence.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty and variation in experimental workflow not accounted for in the model, leading to inaccurate estimations.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited availability of clinical prevalence data for direct comparisons, making it difficult to assess the model’s accuracy.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of quantitative predictions from viral rna concentrations in sewage to actual numbers of cases in the community","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Monte carlo simulation estimation of infections in catchment basin","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited personal contact and physical activities due to public health measures can lead to a decline in mental health and well-being","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Restriction of physical activity for children and adolescents due to covid-19 measures","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decrease in physical activities and increase in other sedentary activities during the pandemic","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential positive effect of physical activity on mental health during a global pandemic","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"}]}
